intro: Calypsodium, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its striking, spiny leaves and showy, often blue or purple, bract-like flowers. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and saline environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Calypsodium species are often used in xeriscaping due to their drought tolerance and ornamental value. Their unique morphology and ecological significance make them an interesting subject in botanical studies.
